intro: Iocaulon ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the Viscaraceae family and is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized structures called haustoria. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forest canopies. Its ecological role includes providing food for certain birds and insects, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
